pli-tv-pvr21:0.2.eng: Legal procedures, why a Monastic Law, resolution of legal issues

pli-tv-pvr21:1.1.eng: There are four kinds of legal procedures:

pli-tv-pvr21:1.2.eng: the legal procedure consisting of getting permission, the legal procedure consisting of one motion, the legal procedure consisting of one motion and one announcement, and the legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements.

pli-tv-pvr21:1.4.eng: In how many ways do they fail?

pli-tv-pvr21:1.6.pli: vatthuto vā ñattito vā anussāvanato vā sīmato vā parisato vā.
pli-tv-pvr21:1.6.eng: with respect to object, motion, announcement, monastery zone, or gathering.

pli-tv-pvr21:2.1.eng: How do legal procedures fail with respect to object?

pli-tv-pvr21:2.2.pli: Sammukhākaraṇīyaṃ kammaṃ asammukhā karoti, vatthuvipannaṃ adhammakammaṃ;
pli-tv-pvr21:2.2.eng: If they don’t do a legal procedure face-to-face that should be done face-to-face, that procedure has failed with respect to object and is illegitimate.

pli-tv-pvr21:2.3.pli: paṭipucchākaraṇīyaṃ kammaṃ appaṭipucchā karoti, vatthuvipannaṃ adhammakammaṃ;
pli-tv-pvr21:2.3.eng: If they do a legal procedure without questioning that should be done with questioning, that procedure has failed with respect to object and is illegitimate.

pli-tv-pvr21:2.4.pli: paṭiññāya karaṇīyaṃ kammaṃ appaṭiññāya karoti, vatthuvipannaṃ adhammakammaṃ;
pli-tv-pvr21:2.4.eng: If they do a legal procedure without admission that should be done by admission, that procedure has failed with respect to object and is illegitimate.

pli-tv-pvr21:2.5.eng: If they apply resolution because of past insanity to one deserving resolution through recollection, that procedure has failed with respect to object and is illegitimate.

pli-tv-pvr21:2.6.eng: If they do a legal procedure of further penalty against one deserving resolution because of past insanity, that procedure has failed with respect to object and is illegitimate.

pli-tv-pvr21:2.7.eng: If they do a legal procedure of condemnation against one deserving a procedure of further penalty, that procedure has failed with respect to object and is illegitimate.

pli-tv-pvr21:2.8.eng: If they do a legal procedure of demotion against one deserving a procedure of condemnation, that procedure has failed with respect to object and is illegitimate.
pli-tv-pvr21:2.8.comm: For an explanation of the rendering “demotion” for niyassa, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-pvr21:2.9.eng: If they do a procedure of banishment against one deserving a procedure of demotion, that procedure has failed with respect to object and is illegitimate.

pli-tv-pvr21:2.10.eng: If they do a procedure of reconciliation against one deserving a procedure of banishment, that procedure has failed with respect to object and is illegitimate.

pli-tv-pvr21:2.11.eng: If they do a legal procedure of ejection against one deserving a procedure of reconciliation, that procedure has failed with respect to object and is illegitimate.

pli-tv-pvr21:2.12.eng: If they give probation to one deserving a procedure of ejection, that procedure has failed with respect to object and is illegitimate.

pli-tv-pvr21:2.13.eng: If they send back to the beginning one deserving probation, that procedure has failed with respect to object and is illegitimate.

pli-tv-pvr21:2.14.eng: If they give the trial period to one deserving to be sent back to the beginning, that procedure has failed with respect to object and is illegitimate.

pli-tv-pvr21:2.15.eng: If they rehabilitate one deserving the trial period, that procedure has failed with respect to object and is illegitimate.

pli-tv-pvr21:2.16.eng: If they give full ordination to one deserving rehabilitation, that procedure has failed with respect to object and is illegitimate.

pli-tv-pvr21:2.17.eng: If they do the observance-day ceremony on a non-observance day, that procedure has failed with respect to object and is illegitimate.

pli-tv-pvr21:2.18.eng: If they do the invitation ceremony on a non-invitation day, that procedure has failed with respect to object and is illegitimate.

pli-tv-pvr21:3.1.eng: How do legal procedures fail with respect to motion?

pli-tv-pvr21:3.3.pli: vatthuṃ na parāmasati, saṅghaṃ na parāmasati, puggalaṃ na parāmasati, ñattiṃ na parāmasati, pacchā vā ñattiṃ ṭhapeti—
pli-tv-pvr21:3.3.eng: they do not touch on the object, the Sangha, the person, or the motion, or the motion is put forward after the announcement.

pli-tv-pvr21:4.1.eng: How do legal procedures fail with respect to announcement?

pli-tv-pvr21:4.3.pli: vatthuṃ na parāmasati, saṅghaṃ na parāmasati, puggalaṃ na parāmasati, sāvanaṃ hāpeti, akāle vā sāveti—
pli-tv-pvr21:4.3.eng: they do not touch on the object, the Sangha, or the person, or an announcement is omitted, or the announcement is made at the wrong time.
pli-tv-pvr21:4.3.comm: Sp 5.485: Sāvanaṁ hāpetīti sabbena sabbaṁ kammavācāya anussāvanaṁ na karoti, ñattidutiyakamme dvikkhattuṁ ñattimeva ṭhapeti, ñatticatutthakamme catukkhattuṁ ñattimeva ṭhapeti; evaṁ anussāvanaṁ hāpeti, “‘The announcement is omitted’: they either do not do the announcement at all; or, in a legal procedure with one motion and one announcement, they just put forward the motion twice; or, in a legal procedure with one motion and three announcements, they just put forward the motion four times. In this way they omit the announcement.” The commentary then goes on to say that even omitting syllables or mispronunciation counts as hāpeti. This, however, goes further than the rules for legal procedures laid down in The Chapter Connected with Campā at Kd 9:3.3.3–3.4.9. | Sp 5.485: Akāle vā sāvetīti sāvanāya akāle anokāse ñattiṁ aṭṭhapetvā paṭhamaṁyeva anussāvanakammaṁ katvā pacchā ñattiṁ ṭhapeti, “‘Or the announcement is made at the wrong time’: it is the wrong time, the wrong occasion, for the announcement. Without putting forward the motion, they first make the announcement and then put forward the motion.”

pli-tv-pvr21:5.1.eng: How do legal procedures fail with respect to the monastery zone?

pli-tv-pvr21:5.3.pli: atikhuddakaṃ sīmaṃ sammannati, atimahatiṃ sīmaṃ sammannati, khaṇḍanimittaṃ sīmaṃ sammannati, chāyānimittaṃ sīmaṃ sammannati, animittaṃ sīmaṃ sammannati, bahisīme ṭhito sīmaṃ sammannati, nadiyā sīmaṃ sammannati, samudde sīmaṃ sammannati, jātassare sīmaṃ sammannati, sīmāya sīmaṃ sambhindati, sīmāya sīmaṃ ajjhottharati—
pli-tv-pvr21:5.3.eng: (1) they establish a zone that is too small; (2) they establish a zone that is too large; (3) they establish an incomplete zone; (4) they establish a zone with a shadow as a zone marker; (5) they establish a zone without zone markers; (6) they establish a zone while standing outside it; (7) they establish a zone in a river; (8) they establish a zone in an ocean; (9) they establish a zone in a lake; (10) they establish a zone that merges with an existing zone; (11) they establish a zone that encloses an existing zone.

pli-tv-pvr21:5.4.pli: imehi ekādasahi ākārehi sīmato kammāni vipajjanti.

pli-tv-pvr21:6.1.eng: How do legal procedures fail with respect to gathering?

pli-tv-pvr21:6.3.pli: catuvaggakaraṇe kamme yāvatikā bhikkhū kammapattā te anāgatā honti, chandārahānaṃ chando anāhaṭo hoti, sammukhībhūtā paṭikkosanti, catuvaggakaraṇe kamme yāvatikā bhikkhū kammapattā te āgatā honti, chandārahānaṃ chando anāhaṭo hoti, sammukhībhūtā paṭikkosanti, catuvaggakaraṇe kamme yāvatikā bhikkhū kammapattā te āgatā honti, chandārahānaṃ chando āhaṭo hoti, sammukhībhūtā paṭikkosanti.
pli-tv-pvr21:6.3.eng: In regard to legal procedures that require a group of four: (1) the monks who should take part haven’t all arrived, consent has not been brought for those who are eligible to give their consent, or someone present objects to the decision; (2) the monks who should take part have arrived, but consent has not been brought for those who are eligible to give their consent, or someone present objects to the decision; (3) the monks who should take part have arrived, and consent has been brought for those who are eligible to give their consent, but someone present objects to the decision.
pli-tv-pvr21:6.3.comm: Sp 3.388: Kammappattoti kammaṁ patto, kammayutto kammāraho; na kiñci kammaṁ kātuṁ nārahatīti attho, “‘Who should be present’: who are able in regard to the legal procedure, suitable for the legal procedure, fit for the legal procedure. The meaning is that one should not not do any kind of legal procedure.” The last line means one should or must take part in the legal procedure.

pli-tv-pvr21:6.4.eng: In regard to legal procedures that require a group of five: … (4-6) …

pli-tv-pvr21:6.5.eng: In regard to legal procedures that require a group of ten: … (7-9) …

pli-tv-pvr21:6.6.pli: vīsativaggakaraṇe kamme yāvatikā bhikkhū kammapattā te anāgatā honti, chandārahānaṃ chando anāhaṭo hoti, sammukhībhūtā paṭikkosanti, vīsativaggakaraṇe kamme yāvatikā bhikkhū kammapattā te āgatā honti, chandārahānaṃ chando anāhaṭo hoti, sammukhībhūtā paṭikkosanti, vīsativaggakaraṇe kamme yāvatikā bhikkhū kammapattā te āgatā honti, chandārahānaṃ chando āhaṭo hoti, sammukhībhūtā paṭikkosanti—
pli-tv-pvr21:6.6.eng: In regard to legal procedures that require a group of twenty: (10) the monks who should take part haven’t all arrived, consent has not been brought for those who are eligible to give their consent, or someone present objects to the decision; (11) the monks who should take part have arrived, but consent has not been brought for those who are eligible to give their consent, or someone present objects to the decision; (12) the monks who should take part have arrived, and consent has been brought for those who are eligible to give their consent, but someone present objects to the decision.

pli-tv-pvr21:6.7.pli: imehi dvādasahi ākārehi parisato kammāni vipajjanti.

pli-tv-pvr21:7.1.pli: Catuvaggakaraṇe kamme cattāro bhikkhū pakatattā kammapattā, avasesā pakatattā chandārahā.
pli-tv-pvr21:7.1.eng: In regard to legal procedures that require a group of four, four regular monks should take part, while the remainder of regular monks are entitled to give their consent.

pli-tv-pvr21:7.2.pli: Yassa saṅgho kammaṃ karoti so neva kammapatto nāpi chandāraho, api ca kammāraho.
pli-tv-pvr21:7.2.eng: The one who is subject to the legal procedure should neither take part in the decision nor give his consent, but is deserving of the legal procedure.
pli-tv-pvr21:7.2.comm: The one who is subject to the legal procedure cannot take part in the legal procedure in the sense of being part of the decision making. However, he needs to be present at the legal procedure when the decision is made.

pli-tv-pvr21:7.3.pli: Pañcavaggakaraṇe kamme pañca bhikkhū pakatattā kammapattā, avasesā pakatattā chandārahā.
pli-tv-pvr21:7.3.eng: In regard to legal procedures that require a group of five, five regular monks should take part, while the remainder of regular monks are entitled to give their consent.

pli-tv-pvr21:7.4.pli: Yassa saṅgho kammaṃ karoti so neva kammapatto nāpi chandāraho, api ca kammāraho.
pli-tv-pvr21:7.4.eng: The one who is subject to the legal procedure should neither take part in the decision nor give his consent, but is deserving of the legal procedure.

pli-tv-pvr21:7.5.pli: Dasavaggakaraṇe kamme dasa bhikkhū pakatattā kammapattā, avasesā pakatattā chandārahā.
pli-tv-pvr21:7.5.eng: In regard to legal procedures that require a group of ten, ten regular monks should take part, while the remainder of regular monks are entitled to give their consent.

pli-tv-pvr21:7.6.pli: Yassa saṅgho kammaṃ karoti so neva kammapatto nāpi chandāraho, api ca kammāraho.
pli-tv-pvr21:7.6.eng: The one who is subject to the legal procedure should neither take part in the decision nor give his consent, but is deserving of the legal procedure.

pli-tv-pvr21:7.7.pli: Vīsativaggakaraṇe kamme vīsati bhikkhū pakatattā kammapattā, avasesā pakatattā chandārahā.
pli-tv-pvr21:7.7.eng: In regard to legal procedures that require a group of twenty, twenty regular monks should take part, while the remainder of regular monks are entitled to give their consent.

pli-tv-pvr21:7.8.pli: Yassa saṅgho kammaṃ karoti so neva kammapatto nāpi chandāraho, api ca kammāraho.
pli-tv-pvr21:7.8.eng: The one who is subject to the legal procedure should neither take part in the decision nor give his consent, but is deserving of the legal procedure.

pli-tv-pvr21:8.1.eng: There are four kinds of legal procedures:

pli-tv-pvr21:8.2.eng: the procedure consisting of getting permission, the procedure consisting of one motion, the procedure consisting of one motion and one announcement, and the procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements.

pli-tv-pvr21:8.3.eng: In how many ways do they fail?

pli-tv-pvr21:8.5.pli: vatthuto vā ñattito vā anussāvanato vā sīmato vā parisato vā.
pli-tv-pvr21:8.5.eng: with respect to object, motion, announcement, monastery zone, or gathering.

pli-tv-pvr21:9.1.eng: How do legal procedures fail with respect to object?

pli-tv-pvr21:9.2.eng: If they give the full ordination to a paṇḍaka, that procedure has failed in object and is illegitimate.
pli-tv-pvr21:9.2.comm: For a discussion of the word paṇḍaka, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-pvr21:9.3.eng: If they give the full ordination to a fake monk, that procedure has failed in object and is illegitimate.

pli-tv-pvr21:9.4.eng: If they give the full ordination to one who has previously left to join the monastics of another religion, that procedure has failed in object and is illegitimate.

pli-tv-pvr21:9.5.eng: If they give the full ordination to an animal, that procedure has failed in object and is illegitimate.

pli-tv-pvr21:9.6.eng: If they give the full ordination to a matricide, that procedure has failed in object and is illegitimate.

pli-tv-pvr21:9.7.eng: If they give the full ordination to a patricide, that procedure has failed in object and is illegitimate.

pli-tv-pvr21:9.8.eng: If they give the full ordination to a murderer of a perfected one, that procedure has failed in object and is illegitimate.

pli-tv-pvr21:9.9.eng: If they give the full ordination to a rapist of a nun, that procedure has failed in object and is illegitimate.
pli-tv-pvr21:9.9.comm: For an explanation of the rendering “rapist” for dūsaka, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-pvr21:9.10.eng: If they give the full ordination to one who has caused a schism in the Sangha, that procedure has failed in object and is illegitimate.

pli-tv-pvr21:9.11.eng: If they give the full ordination to one who has caused the Buddha to bleed, that procedure has failed in object and is illegitimate.

pli-tv-pvr21:9.12.eng: If they give the full ordination to a hermaphrodite, that procedure has failed in object and is illegitimate.
pli-tv-pvr21:9.12.comm: For an explanation of the rendering “gynandromorph” for ubhatobyañjana, see ubhatobyañjanaka in Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-pvr21:9.13.eng: If they give the full ordination to a person less then twenty years old, that procedure has failed in object and is illegitimate.

pli-tv-pvr21:10.1.eng: How do legal procedures fail with respect to motion?

pli-tv-pvr21:10.3.pli: Vatthuṃ na parāmasati, saṅghaṃ na parāmasati, puggalaṃ na parāmasati, ñattiṃ na parāmasati, pacchā vā ñattiṃ ṭhapeti—
pli-tv-pvr21:10.3.eng: they do not touch on the object, the Sangha, the person, or the motion, or the motion is put forward after the announcement.

pli-tv-pvr21:11.1.eng: How do legal procedures fail with respect to announcement?

pli-tv-pvr21:11.3.pli: vatthuṃ na parāmasati, saṅghaṃ na parāmasati, puggalaṃ na parāmasati, sāvanaṃ hāpeti, akāle vā sāveti—
pli-tv-pvr21:11.3.eng: they do not touch on the object, the Sangha, or the person, or an announcement is omitted, or the announcement is made at the wrong time.

pli-tv-pvr21:12.1.eng: How do legal procedures fail with respect to the monastery zone?

pli-tv-pvr21:12.3.pli: Atikhuddakaṃ sīmaṃ sammannati, atimahatiṃ sīmaṃ sammannati, khaṇḍanimittaṃ sīmaṃ sammannati, chāyānimittaṃ sīmaṃ sammannati, animittaṃ sīmaṃ sammannati, bahisīme ṭhito sīmaṃ sammannati, nadiyā sīmaṃ sammannati, samudde sīmaṃ sammannati, jātassare sīmaṃ sammannati, sīmāya sīmaṃ sambhindati, sīmāya sīmaṃ ajjhottharati—
pli-tv-pvr21:12.3.eng: (1) they establish a zone that is too small; (2) they establish a zone that is too large; (3) they establish an incomplete zone; (4) they establish a zone with a shadow as a zone marker; (5) they establish a zone without zone markers; (6) they establish a zone while standing outside it; (7) they establish a zone in a river; (8) they establish a zone in an ocean; (9) they establish a zone in a lake; (10) they establish a zone that merges with an existing zone; (11) they establish a zone that encloses an existing zone.

pli-tv-pvr21:12.4.pli: imehi ekādasahi ākārehi sīmato kammāni vipajjanti.

pli-tv-pvr21:13.1.eng: How do legal procedures fail with respect to gathering?

pli-tv-pvr21:13.3.pli: catuvaggakaraṇe kamme yāvatikā bhikkhū kammapattā te anāgatā honti, chandārahānaṃ chando anāhaṭo hoti, sammukhībhūtā paṭikkosanti, catuvaggakaraṇe kamme yāvatikā bhikkhū kammapattā te āgatā honti, chandārahānaṃ chando anāhaṭo hoti, sammukhībhūtā paṭikkosanti. Catuvaggakaraṇe kamme yāvatikā bhikkhū kammapattā te āgatā honti, chandārahānaṃ chando āhaṭo hoti, sammukhībhūtā paṭikkosanti.
pli-tv-pvr21:13.3.eng: In regard to legal procedures that require a group of four: (1) the monks who should take part haven’t all arrived, consent has not been brought for those who are eligible to give their consent, or someone present objects to the decision; (2) the monks who should take part have arrived, but consent has not been brought for those who are eligible to give their consent, or someone present objects to the decision; (3) the monks who should take part have arrived, and consent has been brought for those who are eligible to give their consent, but someone present objects to the decision.

pli-tv-pvr21:13.4.eng: In regard to legal procedures that require a group of five: … (4-6) …

pli-tv-pvr21:13.5.eng: In regard to legal procedures that require a group of ten: … (7-9) …

pli-tv-pvr21:13.6.pli: vīsativaggakaraṇe kamme yāvatikā bhikkhū kammapattā te anāgatā honti, chandārahānaṃ chando anāhaṭo hoti, sammukhībhūtā paṭikkosanti.
pli-tv-pvr21:13.6.eng: In regard to legal procedures that require a group of twenty: (10) the monks who should take part haven’t all arrived, consent has not been brought for those who are eligible to give their consent, or someone present objects to the decision; (11) the monks who should take part have arrived, but consent has not been brought for those who are eligible to give their consent, or someone present objects to the decision; (12) the monks who should take part have arrived, and consent has been brought for those who are eligible to give their consent, but someone present objects to the decision.

pli-tv-pvr21:13.7.pli: Vīsativaggakaraṇe kamme yāvatikā bhikkhū kammapattā te āgatā honti, chandārahānaṃ chando anāhaṭo hoti, sammukhībhūtā paṭikkosanti. Vīsativaggakaraṇe kamme yāvatikā bhikkhū kammapattā te āgatā honti, chandārahānaṃ chando āhaṭo hoti, sammukhībhūtā paṭikkosanti—imehi dvādasahi ākārehi parisato kammāni vipajjanti.

pli-tv-pvr21:14.1.eng: In how many situations does the legal procedure consisting of getting permission apply?

pli-tv-pvr21:14.2.eng: In how many situations does the legal procedure consisting of one motion apply?

pli-tv-pvr21:14.3.eng: In how many situations does the legal procedure consisting of one motion and one announcement apply?

pli-tv-pvr21:14.4.eng: In how many situations does the legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements apply?

pli-tv-pvr21:14.5.eng: A legal procedure consisting of getting permission applies in five situations.

pli-tv-pvr21:14.6.eng: A legal procedure consisting of one motion applies in nine situations.

pli-tv-pvr21:14.7.eng: A legal procedure consisting of one motion and one announcement applies in seven situations.

pli-tv-pvr21:14.8.eng: A legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements applies in seven situations.

pli-tv-pvr21:15.1.eng: In which five situations does the legal procedure consisting of getting permission apply?

pli-tv-pvr21:15.2.pli: Osāraṇaṃ, nissāraṇaṃ, bhaṇḍukammaṃ, brahmadaṇḍaṃ, kammalakkhaṇaññeva pañcamaṃ—
pli-tv-pvr21:15.2.eng: Admittance, sending away, shaving, the supreme penalty, and any legal procedure with similar characteristics.
pli-tv-pvr21:15.2.comm: In regard to admittance and sending away, the commentary at Sp 5.496 refers to the expulsion and readmittance of a novice monk on account of bad behavior and the subsequent giving up of the same behavior, see Kd 1:60.1.5–60.1.15. As for “shaving”, the commentary refers to the Sangha giving permission to shave someone’s head prior to ordination, see Kd 1:48.2.7. For the “supreme penalty”, see Kd 21:1.12.1–1.12.9. Regarding “any legal procedure with similar characteristics” the commentary points to the allowance for nuns to penalize a monk who is misbehaving toward them, see Kd 20:9.1.4–9.1.24. The commentary at Sp 5.496 then says: Tassa hi kammaññeva lakkhaṇaṁ, na osāraṇādīni; tasmā “kammalakkhaṇa”nti vuccati, “It has the characteristics of a legal procedure, but it is not admittance, etc. Therefore it is called a legal procedure with similar characteristics.”

pli-tv-pvr21:15.4.eng: In which nine situations does the legal procedure consisting of one motion apply?

pli-tv-pvr21:15.5.pli: Osāraṇaṃ, nissāraṇaṃ, uposathaṃ, pavāraṇaṃ, sammutiṃ, dānaṃ, paṭiggahaṃ, paccukkaḍḍhanaṃ, kammalakkhaṇaññeva navamaṃ—
pli-tv-pvr21:15.5.eng: Admittance, sending away, the observance day, the invitation ceremony, agreements, giving, receiving, postponement, and any legal procedure with similar characteristics.
pli-tv-pvr21:15.5.comm: In regard to admittance, the commentary gives the example of Kd 1:76.8.4–76.8.8. In regard to sending away, it quotes Kd 14:14.22.3–14.22.6. For the observance day procedure, see Kd 2:3.3.3–3.3.4. For the invitation procedure, see Kd 4:1.14.3–1.14.5. In regard to agreements, the commentary gives the following examples: Kd 1:76.5.10–76.5.12, Kd 1:76.6.5, Kd 1:76.9.4, Kd 2:15.7.4, Kd 2:15.7.9, Kd 2:15.10.4, and Kd 2:15.10.9. In regard to giving, the commentary refers to the returning of a relinquished robe at Bu NP 1:3.2.11–3.2.13 and Bu NP 1:3.2.20–3.2.22. In regard to receiving, the commentary refers to the receiving of confession at Kd 14:14.32.6–14.32.8 and Kd 14:14.31.6–14.31.12. In regard to postponement, the commentary gives the following examples: Kd 4:17.4.3–17.4.4 and Kd 4:17.5.1–17.5.3.

pli-tv-pvr21:15.7.eng: In which seven situations does the legal procedure consisting of one motion and one announcement apply?

pli-tv-pvr21:15.8.pli: Osāraṇaṃ, nissāraṇaṃ, sammutiṃ, dānaṃ, uddharaṇaṃ, desanaṃ, kammalakkhaṇaññeva sattamaṃ—
pli-tv-pvr21:15.8.eng: Admittance, sending away, agreements, giving, ending of the robe season, approval, and any legal procedure with similar characteristics.
pli-tv-pvr21:15.8.comm: In regard to admittance and sending away, the commentary gives the example of Vaḍḍha the Licchavī at Kd 15:20.4.3–20.4.13 and Kd 15:20.7.8–20.7.20. In regard to agreements, the commentary gives the examples of agreements about monastery zones, e.g. at Kd 2:6.1.10–6.2.7 and Kd 2:12.2.3–12.2.11, about blankets at Bu NP 14:2.22–2.36, and about community officials at Kd 16:21.1.9.0–21.3.37. In regard to giving, the commentary refers to the giving of the robe of the robe-making ceremony at Kd 7:1.4.2–1.4.12. In regard to ending of the robe season, the commentary refers to Bi Pc 30:1.1.10–1.1.18. In regard to approval, the commentary mentions the approval of a site for the building of a hut at Bu Ss 6:2.2.35–2.2.48. Finally, in regard to a legal procedure with similar characteristics, the commentary suggest the procedure of covering over as if with grass at Kd 14:13.3.2–13.3.14.

pli-tv-pvr21:15.10.eng: In which seven situations does the legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements apply?

pli-tv-pvr21:15.11.pli: Osāraṇaṃ, nissāraṇaṃ, sammutiṃ, dānaṃ, niggahaṃ, samanubhāsanaṃ, kammalakkhaṇaññeva sattamaṃ—
pli-tv-pvr21:15.11.eng: Admittance, sending away, agreements, giving, restraining, pressing, and any legal procedure with similar characteristics.
pli-tv-pvr21:15.11.comm: In regard to admittance and sending away, the commentary gives the example of the seven legal procedures that impose penalties in Kd 11. In regard to agreements, the commentary gives the example of appointing an instructor of the nuns at Bu Pc 21:1.27–1.41. In regard to giving and restraining, the commentary refers to the giving of probation and the trial period, and to restraining by sending back to the beginning, all in connection with offenses entailing suspension at Kd 13. In regard to pressing, the commentary refers to the eleven offenses entailing suspension, four for the monks and seven unique ones for the nuns, that are committed when pressed for the third time. Finally, in regard to a legal procedure with similar characteristics, the commentary points to the ordination procedure at Kd 1:76.10.2–76.12.16, and the rehabilitation procedure, starting at Kd 13:2.3.2–2.3.36.

pli-tv-pvr21:16.1.pli: Catuvaggakaraṇe kamme cattāro bhikkhū pakatattā kammapattā, avasesā pakatattā chandārahā.
pli-tv-pvr21:16.1.eng: In regard to legal procedures that require a group of four, four regular monks should take part, while the remainder of regular monks are entitled to give their consent.

pli-tv-pvr21:16.2.pli: Yassa saṅgho kammaṃ karoti so neva kammapatto nāpi chandāraho, api ca kammāraho.
pli-tv-pvr21:16.2.eng: The one who is subject to the legal procedure should neither take part in the decision nor give his consent, but is deserving of the legal procedure.

pli-tv-pvr21:16.3.pli: Pañcavaggakaraṇe kamme pañca bhikkhū pakatattā kammapattā, avasesā pakatattā chandārahā.
pli-tv-pvr21:16.3.eng: In regard to legal procedures that require a group of five, five regular monks should take part, while the remainder of regular monks are entitled to give their consent.

pli-tv-pvr21:16.4.pli: Yassa saṅgho kammaṃ karoti so neva kammapatto nāpi chandāraho, api ca kammāraho.
pli-tv-pvr21:16.4.eng: The one who is subject to the legal procedure should neither take part in the decision nor give his consent, but is deserving of the legal procedure.

pli-tv-pvr21:16.5.pli: Dasavaggakaraṇe kamme dasa bhikkhū pakatattā kammapattā, avasesā pakatattā chandārahā.
pli-tv-pvr21:16.5.eng: In regard to legal procedures that require a group of ten, ten regular monks should take part, while the remainder of regular monks are entitled to give their consent.

pli-tv-pvr21:16.6.pli: Yassa saṅgho kammaṃ karoti so neva kammapatto nāpi chandāraho, api ca kammāraho.
pli-tv-pvr21:16.6.eng: The one who is subject to the legal procedure should neither take part in the decision nor give his consent, but is deserving of the legal procedure.

pli-tv-pvr21:16.7.pli: Vīsativaggakaraṇe kamme vīsati bhikkhū pakatattā kammapattā, avasesā pakatattā chandārahā.
pli-tv-pvr21:16.7.eng: In regard to legal procedures that require a group of twenty, twenty regular monks should take part, while the remainder of regular monks are entitled to give their consent.

pli-tv-pvr21:16.8.pli: Yassa saṅgho kammaṃ karoti so neva kammapatto nāpi chandāraho, api ca kammāraho.
pli-tv-pvr21:16.8.eng: The one who is subject to the legal procedure should neither take part in the decision nor give his consent, but is deserving of the legal procedure.

pli-tv-pvr21:17.1.eng: The first subchapter on legal procedures is finished.

pli-tv-pvr21:18.1.pli: Dve atthavase paṭicca tathāgatena sāvakānaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr21:18.1.eng: The Buddha laid down the training rules for his disciples for two reasons:

pli-tv-pvr21:18.2.eng: for the well-being of the Sangha and for the comfort of the Sangha.

pli-tv-pvr21:18.3.pli: ime dve atthavase paṭicca tathāgatena sāvakānaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ.

pli-tv-pvr21:19.1.pli: Dve atthavase paṭicca tathāgatena sāvakānaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr21:19.1.eng: The Buddha laid down the training rules for his disciples for two reasons:

pli-tv-pvr21:19.2.pli: Dummaṅkūnaṃ puggalānaṃ niggahāya, pesalānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ phāsuvihārāya—
pli-tv-pvr21:19.2.eng: for the restraint of bad people and for the ease of good monks.

pli-tv-pvr21:19.3.pli: ime dve atthavase paṭicca tathāgatena sāvakānaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ.

pli-tv-pvr21:20.1.pli: Dve atthavase paṭicca tathāgatena sāvakānaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ.

pli-tv-pvr21:20.2.pli: Diṭṭhadhammikānaṃ āsavānaṃ saṃvarāya, samparāyikānaṃ āsavānaṃ paṭighātāya—
pli-tv-pvr21:20.2.eng: for the restraint of the corruptions relating to the present life and for the restraint of the corruptions relating to future lives.

pli-tv-pvr21:20.3.pli: ime dve atthavase paṭicca tathāgatena sāvakānaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ.

pli-tv-pvr21:21.2.pli: Diṭṭhadhammikānaṃ verānaṃ saṃvarāya, samparāyikānaṃ verānaṃ paṭighātāya—
pli-tv-pvr21:21.2.eng: for the restraint of threats relating to the present life and for avoiding threats relating to future lives.

pli-tv-pvr21:21.3.pli: ime dve atthavase paṭicca tathāgatena sāvakānaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ.

pli-tv-pvr21:25.2.eng: out of compassion for householders and for breaking up the factions of those with bad desires.

pli-tv-pvr21:27.1.eng: The Buddha laid down the training rules for his disciples for two reasons:

pli-tv-pvr21:27.2.eng: for the longevity of the true Teaching and for supporting the training.
pli-tv-pvr21:27.2.comm: For an explanation of the rendering “training” for vinaya, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-pvr21:27.3.pli: ime dve atthavase paṭicca tathāgatena sāvakānaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ.

pli-tv-pvr21:28.1.eng: The second subchapter on reasons is finished.

pli-tv-pvr21:29.1.pli: Dve atthavase paṭicca tathāgatena sāvakānaṃ pātimokkhaṃ paññattaṃ …pe…
pli-tv-pvr21:29.1.eng: The Buddha laid down the Monastic Code for his disciples for two reasons: …

pli-tv-pvr21:29.2.eng: laid down the recitation of the Monastic Code …

pli-tv-pvr21:29.3.eng: laid down the canceling of the Monastic Code …

pli-tv-pvr21:29.5.eng: laid down the canceling of the invitation ceremony …

pli-tv-pvr21:29.6.eng: laid down the legal procedure of condemnation …

pli-tv-pvr21:29.7.eng: laid down the legal procedure of demotion …

pli-tv-pvr21:29.8.eng: laid down the legal procedure of banishment …

pli-tv-pvr21:29.9.eng: laid down the legal procedure of reconciliation …

pli-tv-pvr21:29.10.eng: laid down the legal procedure of ejection …

pli-tv-pvr21:29.11.eng: laid down the giving of probation …

pli-tv-pvr21:29.12.eng: laid down the sending back to the beginning …

pli-tv-pvr21:29.13.eng: laid down the giving of the trial period …

pli-tv-pvr21:29.18.eng: laid down the legal procedure consisting of getting permission …

pli-tv-pvr21:29.19.eng: laid down the legal procedure consisting of one motion …

pli-tv-pvr21:29.20.eng: laid down the legal procedure consisting of one motion and one announcement …

pli-tv-pvr21:29.21.eng: laid down the legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements …

pli-tv-pvr21:30.1.eng: The third subchapter on laying down is finished.

pli-tv-pvr21:31.0.eng: 4. The subchapter on “laid down a rule when there was no existing rule”

pli-tv-pvr21:31.2.eng: laid down a rule when there was no existing rule, and laid down an addition to an existing rule …
pli-tv-pvr21:31.2.comm: Sp 5.500: Apaññatte paññattanti sattāpattikkhandhā kakusandhañca sammāsambuddhaṁ koṇāgamanañca kassapañca sammāsambuddhaṁ ṭhapetvā antarā kenaci apaññatte sikkhāpade paññattaṁ nāma. Makkaṭivatthuādivinītakathā sikkhāpade paññatte anupaññattaṁ nāma, “‘Laid down a rule when there was no existing rule’: apart from the fully Awakened Buddhas Kakusandha, Koṇāgamana, and Kassapa, by whomever, when there was no existing rule, something was laid down among the seven classes of offenses. This is called laid down. When, in regard to a training rule, there is a subsidiary case story, such as the story of the monkey, etc., it is called ‘laid down an addition to an existing rule’.”

pli-tv-pvr21:31.5.eng: laid down resolution because of past insanity …

pli-tv-pvr21:31.6.eng: laid down acting according to what has been admitted …

pli-tv-pvr21:31.9.eng: laid down the covering over as if with grass for the well-being of the Sangha and for the comfort of the Sangha.

pli-tv-pvr21:31.10.pli: ime dve atthavase paṭicca tathāgatena sāvakānaṃ tiṇavatthārako paññatto.

pli-tv-pvr21:32.1.eng: The Buddha laid down the covering over as if with grass for his disciples for two reasons:

pli-tv-pvr21:32.2.pli: Dummaṅkūnaṃ puggalānaṃ niggahāya, pesalānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ phāsuvihārāya—
pli-tv-pvr21:32.2.eng: for the restraint of bad people and for the ease of good monks.

pli-tv-pvr21:32.3.pli: ime dve atthavase paṭicca tathāgatena sāvakānaṃ tiṇavatthārako paññatto.

pli-tv-pvr21:33.2.eng: for the restraint of the corruptions relating to the present life and for the restraint of the corruptions relating to future lives.

pli-tv-pvr21:41.1.eng: The fourth subchapter on “laid down a rule when there was no existing rule” is finished.

pli-tv-pvr21:42.0.eng: 5. The subchapter on nine kinds of “being found among”

pli-tv-pvr21:42.1.eng: “There are nine kinds of ‘being found among’:

pli-tv-pvr21:42.2.pli: vatthusaṅgaho, vipattisaṅgaho āpattisaṅgaho, nidānasaṅgaho, puggalasaṅgaho, khandhasaṅgaho, samuṭṭhānasaṅgaho, adhikaraṇasaṅgaho, samathasaṅgahoti.
pli-tv-pvr21:42.2.eng: being found among the actions that are the bases for offenses, being found among the failures, being found among the offenses, being found among the origin stories, being found among persons, being found among the classes, being found among the originations, being found among the legal issues, and being found among the settling of legal issues.

pli-tv-pvr21:43.1.pli: Adhikaraṇe samuppanne sace ubho atthapaccatthikā āgacchanti ubhinnampi vatthu ārocāpetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr21:43.1.eng: When a legal issue has arisen, if the two opponents come, they should be told to inform about the action that was the basis for the disagreement.

pli-tv-pvr21:43.2.pli: Ubhinnampi vatthuṃ ārocāpetvā ubhinnampi paṭiññā sotabbā.
pli-tv-pvr21:43.2.eng: After hearing the testimony of both,

pli-tv-pvr21:43.4.pli: “amhākaṃ imasmiṃ adhikaraṇe vūpasamite ubhopi tuṭṭhā bhavissathā”ti.
pli-tv-pvr21:43.4.eng: ‘When we’ve resolved this legal issue, you should both be satisfied.’

pli-tv-pvr21:43.6.pli: “ubhopi tuṭṭhā bhavissāmā”ti, saṅghena taṃ adhikaraṇaṃ sampaṭicchitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr21:43.6.eng: ‘We’ll both be satisfied,’ then the Sangha should take on that legal issue.

pli-tv-pvr21:43.7.pli: Sace alajjussannā hoti, parisā ubbāhikāya vūpasametabbaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr21:43.7.eng: If there are many shameless people in the gathering, then the issue should be resolved by means of a committee.

pli-tv-pvr21:43.8.pli: Sace bālussannā hoti, parisā vinayadharo pariyesitabbo yena dhammena yena vinayena yena satthusāsanena taṃ adhikaraṇaṃ vūpasammati.
pli-tv-pvr21:43.8.eng: If there are many ignorant people in the gathering, they should search for an expert on the Monastic Law to resolve that legal issue in accordance with the Teaching, the Monastic Law, and the Teacher’s instruction.

pli-tv-pvr21:43.9.eng: That legal issue should be resolved in this way.

pli-tv-pvr21:44.1.pli: Vatthu jānitabbaṃ, gottaṃ jānitabbaṃ, nāmaṃ jānitabbaṃ, āpatti jānitabbā.
pli-tv-pvr21:44.1.eng: One should know the basis for an offense, one should know the category, one should know the name, and one should know the offense.

pli-tv-pvr21:45.1.eng: ‘Sexual intercourse’ is the basis for an offense, as well as a category.

pli-tv-pvr21:45.2.eng: ‘Offense entailing expulsion’ is the name, as well as the offense.

pli-tv-pvr21:46.1.eng: ‘Stealing’ is the basis for an offense, as well as a category.

pli-tv-pvr21:46.2.eng: ‘Offense entailing expulsion’ is the name, as well as the offense.

pli-tv-pvr21:47.1.eng: ‘Human being’ is the basis for an offense, as well as a category.

pli-tv-pvr21:47.2.eng: ‘Offense entailing expulsion’ is the name, as well as the offense.

pli-tv-pvr21:48.1.eng: ‘Superhuman quality’ is the basis for an offense, as well as a category.

pli-tv-pvr21:48.2.eng: ‘Offense entailing expulsion’ is the name, as well as the offense.

pli-tv-pvr21:49.1.eng: ‘Emission of semen’ is the basis for an offense, as well as a category.

pli-tv-pvr21:49.2.eng: ‘Offense entailing suspension’ is the name, as well as the offense.

pli-tv-pvr21:50.1.eng: ‘Physical contact’ is the basis for an offense, as well as a category.

pli-tv-pvr21:50.2.eng: ‘Offense entailing suspension’ is the name, as well as the offense.

pli-tv-pvr21:51.1.eng: ‘Indecent speech’ is the basis for an offense, as well as a category.

pli-tv-pvr21:51.2.eng: ‘Offense entailing suspension’ is the name, as well as the offense.

pli-tv-pvr21:52.1.eng: ‘One’s own desires’ is the basis for an offense, as well as a category.

pli-tv-pvr21:52.2.eng: ‘Offense entailing suspension’ is the name, as well as the offense.

pli-tv-pvr21:53.1.eng: ‘Matchmaking’ is the basis for an offense, as well as a category.

pli-tv-pvr21:53.2.eng: ‘Offense entailing suspension’ is the name, as well as the offense.

pli-tv-pvr21:54.1.pli: Saññācikāya kuṭiṃ kārāpananti vatthu ceva gottañca—
pli-tv-pvr21:54.1.eng: ‘Building a hut by means of begging’ is the basis for an offense, as well as a category.

pli-tv-pvr21:54.2.eng: ‘Offense entailing suspension’ is the name, as well as the offense.

pli-tv-pvr21:55.1.pli: Mahallakaṃ vihāraṃ kārāpananti vatthu ceva gottañca—
pli-tv-pvr21:55.1.eng: ‘Building a large dwelling’ is the basis for an offense, as well as a category.

pli-tv-pvr21:55.2.eng: ‘Offense entailing suspension’ is the name, as well as the offense.

pli-tv-pvr21:56.1.pli: Bhikkhuṃ amūlakena pārājikena dhammena anuddhaṃsananti vatthu ceva gottañca—
pli-tv-pvr21:56.1.eng: ‘Groundlessly charging a monk with an offense entailing expulsion’ is the basis for an offense, as well as a category.

pli-tv-pvr21:56.2.eng: ‘Offense entailing suspension’ is the name, as well as the offense.

pli-tv-pvr21:57.1.pli: Bhikkhuṃ aññabhāgiyassa adhikaraṇassa kiñci desaṃ lesamattaṃ upādāya pārājikena dhammena anuddhaṃsananti vatthu ceva gottañca—
pli-tv-pvr21:57.1.eng: ‘Charging a monk with an offense entailing expulsion, using an unrelated legal issue as a pretext’ is the basis for an offense, as well as a category.

pli-tv-pvr21:57.2.eng: ‘Offense entailing suspension’ is the name, as well as the offense.

pli-tv-pvr21:58.1.pli: Saṅghabhedakassa bhikkhuno yāvatatiyaṃ samanubhāsanāya na paṭinissajjananti vatthu ceva gottañca—
pli-tv-pvr21:58.1.eng: ‘A monk not stopping with pursuing schism in the Sangha when pressed for the third time’ is the basis for an offense, as well as a category.

pli-tv-pvr21:58.2.eng: ‘Offense entailing suspension’ is the name, as well as the offense.

pli-tv-pvr21:59.1.pli: Bhedakānuvattakānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ yāvatatiyaṃ samanubhāsanāya na paṭinissajjananti vatthu ceva gottañca—
pli-tv-pvr21:59.1.eng: ‘Monks not stopping siding with one who is pursuing schism in the Sangha when pressed for the third time’ is the basis for an offense, as well as a category.

pli-tv-pvr21:59.2.eng: ‘Offense entailing suspension’ is the name, as well as the offense.

pli-tv-pvr21:60.1.pli: Dubbacassa bhikkhuno yāvatatiyaṃ samanubhāsanāya na paṭinissajjananti vatthu ceva gottañca—
pli-tv-pvr21:60.1.eng: ‘A monk not stopping with being difficult to correct when pressed for the third time’ is the basis for an offense, as well as a category.

pli-tv-pvr21:60.2.eng: ‘Offense entailing suspension’ is the name, as well as the offense.

pli-tv-pvr21:61.1.pli: Kuladūsakassa bhikkhuno yāvatatiyaṃ samanubhāsanāya na paṭinissajjananti vatthu ceva gottañca—
pli-tv-pvr21:61.1.eng: ‘A monk not stopping with being a corrupter of families when pressed for the third time’ is the basis for an offense, as well as a category.

pli-tv-pvr21:61.2.eng: ‘Offense entailing suspension’ is the name, as well as the offense. …

pli-tv-pvr21:62.1.pli: Anādariyaṃ paṭicca udake uccāraṃ vā passāvaṃ vā kheḷaṃ vā karaṇanti vatthu ceva gottañca—
pli-tv-pvr21:62.1.eng: ‘Out of disrespect, defecating, urinating, or spitting in water’ is the basis for an offense, as well as a category.

pli-tv-pvr21:62.2.eng: ‘Offense of wrong conduct’ is the name, as well as the offense.”

pli-tv-pvr21:63.1.eng: The fifth subchapter on nine kinds of “being found among” is finished.

pli-tv-pvr21:65.2.eng: One motion and one announcement, and with one motion and three announcements;

pli-tv-pvr21:66.4.eng: Motions, and not the motion afterwards.

pli-tv-pvr21:67.2.eng: Announcement, and at the wrong time;

pli-tv-pvr21:67.4.comm: Reading this as a single compound khaṇḍacchāyānimittakā with SRT, which allows the final word to be read as animittakā.

pli-tv-pvr21:68.1.eng: Outside, river, and in an ocean,

pli-tv-pvr21:68.4.eng: A group of four, and of five.

pli-tv-pvr21:69.1.eng: A group of ten, and of twenty,

pli-tv-pvr21:69.3.eng: Who should take part, eligible to give their consent,

pli-tv-pvr21:69.4.eng: And person deserving of the legal procedure.

pli-tv-pvr21:70.2.eng: And nine situations for one motion;

pli-tv-pvr21:70.3.eng: Seven situations for one motion and one announcement,

pli-tv-pvr21:70.4.eng: Seven situations for one motion and three announcements.

pli-tv-pvr21:72.1.eng: Those with bad desires, those without confidence,

pli-tv-pvr21:72.2.eng: Confidence, the longevity of the Teaching;

pli-tv-pvr21:72.4.eng: The Monastic Code, and with the recitation.

pli-tv-pvr21:73.1.eng: And the canceling of the Monastic Code,

pli-tv-pvr21:73.2.eng: And the invitation ceremony, its suspension;

pli-tv-pvr21:75.2.eng: One motion and one announcement, one motion and three announcements;

pli-tv-pvr21:75.3.eng: When there was no existing rule, laid down an addition,

pli-tv-pvr21:76.2.eng: Further penalty, covering over as if with grass;

pli-tv-pvr21:79.1.eng: The canonical text of the Compendium is finished.

pli-tv-pvr21:81.2.eng: About the practice of past teachers—

pli-tv-pvr21:82.2.eng: With a path for study, in the middle;

pli-tv-pvr21:82.3.eng: Having thought it out, he had it written down,

pli-tv-pvr21:83.2.eng: With all bases for offenses with their characteristics,

pli-tv-pvr21:83.3.eng: Meaning in accord with the meaning in the true Teaching,

pli-tv-pvr21:83.4.eng: Rule in accord with the rule in what is laid down.

pli-tv-pvr21:84.4.eng: How does one decide on the rules?

pli-tv-pvr21:85.1.eng: How does one decide on failures, bases, rules,

pli-tv-pvr21:85.3.eng: Whether on each side or on both sides,

pli-tv-pvr21:85.4.eng: A rule by convention from a moral fault?

pli-tv-pvr21:86.1.eng: When anyone gives rise to doubt,

pli-tv-pvr21:86.2.eng: It is cut off by the Compendium;

pli-tv-pvr21:86.3.eng: Like a universal monarch in the midst of his great army,

pli-tv-pvr21:86.4.eng: Like a lion in a herd of deer;

pli-tv-pvr21:87.1.eng: Like the sun surrounded by its rays,

pli-tv-pvr21:87.2.eng: Like the moon in the starry sky;

pli-tv-pvr21:87.3.eng: Like the Supreme Being in his assembly,

pli-tv-pvr21:87.4.eng: Like a leader with his retinue—

pli-tv-pvr21:87.5.eng: In this way, the true Teaching and the Monastic Law
